item.title: Looks Aren’t Everything? Clavicular Begs to Differ.
item.description: Braden Peters, known as Clavicular, has emerged as a beacon for a group of narcissistic, status-obsessed young men. He wants to take his fixation with “looksmaxxing” mainstream.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Bernstein
item.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
item.media:description: The 20-year-old streamer goes to extremes to achieve an ideal of male beauty, but that’s not the only reason he’s become an online sensation.

item.title: Mamdani Surprises Couples at City Hall and Officiates Their Weddings
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani stopped by City Hall last Thursday, stepping in to officiate weddings and shocking couples as they arrived for their appointments.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann

item.title: The Objects We Keep for Love
item.description: We asked readers to share the items they’ve held on to as reminders of love. The responses ranged from uplifting and funny to heartachingly sad.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: Rewriting the Fashion Rules at Proenza Schouler
item.description: With her first show for Proenza Schouler, Rachel Scott was trying to pull off more than a reinvention.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Tara Lipinski and Johnny Weir Are Skating Their Way Through “The Traitors”
item.description: On “The Traitors,” two American Olympians turned skating commentators have become fan favorites by embracing the roles of lovable fools.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy
item.media:description: The two friends shared a candid moment at a hotel in South Korea in 2018.

item.title: How Did Pat McGrath Cosmetics Go From Billion-Dollar Brand to Bankruptcy?
item.description: The makeup artist Pat McGrath was a favorite of Taylor Swift, Kim Kardashian and Madonna. Then she became a billion-dollar brand.
item.dc:creator: Linda Wells

item.title: Rachel Scott Wants to Dress the New New York Woman
item.description: Rachel Scott, the new designer of Proenza Schouler, wants to dress the city for the future — and for the world.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Daniela Spector for The New York Times

item.title: Ralph Lauren’s Not-So-Gilded Age
item.description: The designer goes hunting in the fields of style past.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman and Simbarashe Cha
item.media:description: Tweed suiting and a Braveheart shearling at Ralph Lauren.

item.title: What to Watch After Watching Marc Jacobs
item.description: A ’90s-tinged fashion show has our critic thinking about an underappreciated ’90s movie.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: At an Anti-Valentine’s Day Party, People Commiserate and Celebrate Heartbreak
item.description: On the Monday after Valentine’s Day, guests celebrated not love, but the pain of heartbreak and the cathartic relief of commiseration, at the “Ex Files” party.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta
item.media:credit: Ye Fan for The New York Times

item.title: Frederick Vreeland, Diplomat and Spy Who Served With Style, Dies at 98
item.description: A son of the influential fashion editor Diana Vreeland, he had an upbringing well suited to his overt and covert duties during the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Colorful and Warm Outfits
item.description: A conversation about his red coat offered glimpses of other ways the color had entered their lives.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: T-Shirts Gave Me the Education I Never Got at School
item.description: I was a nervous Gen Z kid who wanted to lead a bolder life — so I turned to clothing older than I am.
item.dc:creator: Maddie Barron
item.media:credit: Alexis Kleshik for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Brick’ It. Chain It to a Wall. How Far Would You Go to Get Away From Your Phone?
item.description: How did our relationship to our phones become so antagonistic?
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher and Adam Powell
item.media:credit: Adam Powell for The New York Times

item.title: Abe Lincoln Fans Gather for Mutton Hunks and a Vintage American Flag
item.description: An old Manhattan steakhouse is the new home for the Stars and Stripes that draped the 16th president’s casket.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vadukul and Graham Dickie
item.media:credit: Graham Dickie for The New York Times

item.title: Should I Dress Like My Younger Co-Workers?
item.description: Office attire has morphed significantly over the years. Our critic shares her thoughts on sticking to your style versus changing with the times.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Crotch Fabric, Blue Skin Suits and Other Mysteries of Olympic Gear
item.description: Before going for the gold, athletes at the Winter Games must check their apparel and equipment. Or else.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola
item.media:description: Did the color of Jordan Stolz’s suit have anything to do with his record-setting speedskating wins?

item.title: Good News, Millennials: The Side Part Has Returned
item.description: After Gen Z’s embrace of the center part, hair appears to be migrating sideways once again.
item.dc:creator: Rory Satran
item.media:description: The singer Addison Rae showed off her side part at this year’s Grammy Awards.

item.title: Independent Spirit Awards Winners 2026: See the Complete List
item.description: Here’s who went home with an Indie Spirit Award on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.media:description: Eva Victor won the Best Screenplay award for her film “Sorry, Baby.”

item.title: See the Looks From the 2026 Independent Spirit Awards
item.description: The awards show, which celebrates independent film and television, moved back to the Hollywood Palladium for this year’s awards show.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.media:description: Rose Byrne, winner for Best Lead Performance for “If I Had Legs I’d Kick You.”

item.title: A Speed Dating Event Where You Can Body-Slam Your Crush
item.description: At a wrestling speed dating event in Brooklyn, young people spent Valentine’s Day getting physical with strangers in hopes of finding love.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann
item.media:credit: Mila De La Torre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Luiz Campos, top, and Tasneem Sarjoo tested their chemistry on the mat at a wrestling speed dating event on Saturday night.

item.title: Bicepmaxxing at Calvin Klein
item.description: The muscles were more memorable than the clothes.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Epstein Files Hint at His Ties to the Supermodel Naomi Campbell
item.description: Ms. Campbell previously claimed she was an acquaintance of the convicted sex offender. Emails shed new light on the extent of their interactions.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Jesse McKinley
item.media:description: Naomi Campbell modeling in a fashion show in Paris in October 2025.

item.title: On the Las Vegas Strip, Local Acts at Delilah and Elsewhere Set the Vibe
item.description: On the Strip and beyond, clubs, bars and restaurants spotlight local performers who deliver some of the city’s best entertainment.
item.dc:creator: Alex Schechter and Tag Christof

item.title: Making the Dancing Lions for Lunar New York Celebrations
item.description: In a San Francisco garage, Corey Chan and his team create giant, spectacular lions that will lead the festivities.
item.dc:creator: Miya Lee and Jake Michaels

item.title: The Magic Ring Hanging From the Sasha Calle Neck From Netflix’s “The Rip”
item.description: The actress from Netflix’s “The Rip” doesn’t allow anyone else to touch the ring, one of the rules that keep its magic alive.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Diamond
item.media:credit: Celeste Sloman for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I think I hold it with love and joy, and I’m grateful for it — not because of its magic qualities, but because it just holds a very tender memory,” said Sasha Calle.

item.title: What Would Carolyn Bessette Kennedy Have Thought of the New Calvin Klein?
item.description: As Ryan Murphy’s “Love Story” premieres, so does the Calvin Klein show. They don’t have the same style.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.category: Love Story: John F. Kennedy Jr. & Carolyn Bessette (TV Program)

item.title: Partiful, Gen Z’s Favorite Party App, Wants to Know Who Your Crush Is
item.description: A new feature on the Partiful app invites users to secretly identify a fellow partygoer as a crush. But do in-person gatherings really need help from Big Tech to facilitate a connection?
item.dc:creator: Gina Cherelus

item.title: Olympic Figure Skating Is a Young Woman’s Sport. Deanna Stellato-Dudek Wants to Change That.
item.description: Deanna Stellato-Dudek, a Canadian pairs skater, is trying to make history at the Olympics — despite a training accident a week before the Games.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Nasuna Stuart-Ulin for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ms. Stellato-Dudek poses in the Oscar de la Renta skating dress she expects to wear for her long program. Each of its more than 200,000 glass beads was triple-knotted by hand.

item.title: Can a Brand Reboot Ever Really Work?
item.description: Public School is trying. And perhaps succeeding.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Who Says Luxury Gifts Have to Cost a Lot?
item.description: Here are 10 items that feel extravagant but won’t require emptying your wallet.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Gomelsky

item.title: Hats Have Hidden Talents as Great Gifts
item.description: Some are one-size-fits-all and some can be worn year-round. What’s not to like?
item.dc:creator: David Belcher
item.media:description: In the film “Sinners,” Michael B. Jordan wears both a fedora and a flat cap in his performance as twins.

item.title: They Waited Until They Didn’t Have to Anymore
item.description: Jeff Melsheimer and Izzie Shea both had to be patient in their journey to find each other.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: He Came With a Hearty Endorsement From His Ex-Fiancée
item.description: Danielle Garonce first noticed Daniel Grossman as “the fiancé who grows eggplants” on her friend’s Instagram. Once that engagement was over, they made their own match.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: They Took a Swing at Dating Again
item.description: Ryan Smith and Andrea Gallo were both newly single when they met on an intramural softball league in New Jersey.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: Settled in Seattle After a Long-Distance Relationship
item.description: Samantha Smith and Aaron Davis fell in love with the city and each other while she was working as a traveling nurse.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: I Had Buyer’s Remorse. It Almost Ended My Marriage.
item.description: When you can’t agree on the right city to live in, home can be more hell than haven.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Delamatre

item.title: 35 Modern Dating Rules That People Rely on Today
item.description: On Valentine’s Day 31 years ago, the book “The Rules” provided 35 decidedly retro “rules” for dating. We thought it was time for a refresh, so we asked people what rules they rely on today. Here are the best.
item.dc:creator: Miya Lee, Daniel Jones and Antonio de Luca
item.media:credit: Antonio de Luca/The New York Times

item.title: My Sister Has Been Cruel to Me Since Her Husband Died
item.description: Our Ask the Therapist columnist, Lori Gottlieb, advises a reader who is feuding with a sister after the death of her spouse.
item.dc:creator: Lori Gottlieb

item.title: Meet the Real-Life Hitch
item.description: Michael Asibuo helps men feel more confident in their dating lives. With Valentine’s Day approaching, he’s been busy helping clients plan dates.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan and Clara Lacasse
item.media:description: Clients typically pay $5,000 to $12,000 for Mr. Asibuo’s services. Most are men in their late 20s and early 30s who are interested in developing genuine long-term relationships.

item.title: He Designed a Clock to Have a Peaceful Start to the Day
item.description: Jamie Kripke designed an analog clock that he said won’t “scare you awake.” Instead, it plays one of seven melodies specifically composed to arouse you gently.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Morelli
item.media:credit: Andrew Faulk for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jamie Kripke, founder of OneClock, said the product was born out of an effort to encourage better sleep by getting the phone out of the bedroom and better mornings through a beautiful waking experience.”

item.title: Words of Love or Friendship Can Be a Gift
item.description: Not only would a recipient have a letter or note to treasure, but experts say the act of writing can give you personal benefits, too.
item.dc:creator: Alix Strauss
item.media:description: “Writing by hand connects us to our bodies in a calming, soothing, rhythmic way that typing doesn’t,” said Kathleen Adams, a licensed professional counselor who is the director of the Center for Journal Therapy.

item.title: Why Nancy Guthrie’s Disappearance Is Breaking Through the Noise
item.description: A vulnerable victim, an unknown perpetrator and a recognizable celebrity are all factors in a case that has captivated the public.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley
item.media:description: Elements of Nancy Guthrie’s kidnapping case have set it apart, including the universality, and relatability, of the victim: an elderly mother in peril.

item.title: The Internet Is Embracing Chinese Traditions, and Influencers Welcome Them All
item.description: Think of the meme from Chinese American influencers as an absurdist joke, a wellness goal or an ironic expression of protest — or all of the above. Your ethnicity is beside the point.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Will You Take the Sex Plant?’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring stories of no more than 100 words submitted by readers.

item.title: My Brother Wrote Me a Nasty Letter. Why Haven’t My Parents Gotten Involved?
item.description: After her brother accused her of years of mistreatment in a no-holds-barred letter, a reader feels that her parents’ neutrality is tantamount to taking his side.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: How the Ultra-Rich Travel
item.description: Inside the arms race to satisfy travelers for whom exclusivity is everything and money is no object.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Lyall
